name: 70 Vir
scenarioDescription:
The 70 Vir Exoplanetary System


Overview

70 Vir is a star with 1.09 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.89 times its radius. It is located 58.41 light years away from the solar system.

70 Vir is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 70 Vir system


70 Vir b

70 Vir b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.48 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 70 Vir b is 2358.288 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 70 Vir b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 70 Vir, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Lick Observatory.
